First notes on Learning Skills (Techs)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance Archive (GameBoy Advance): Techs: First notes on Learning Skills (Techs)
By John Hawley on Friday, December 14, 2001 - 03:15 pm:

Very earliest notes on learning skills in the Special Training.

Lisa had speculated that there might be stat level restrictions on learning new skills. This appears to play at least some role. I took a brand new Nymph to the AGIMA Hall and checked her out. With all stats below 150 except INT, everything but Sense said it was unlikely to learn a new skill. However, after one (1) LD in INT, suddenly all the courses except Pow showed a possibility to learn a new skill. After one LD in Pow, all courses show a "possibilty".

This makes me wonder if Loyalty doesn't also play a role. Of course, that is a wild speculation, to be confirmed or booted out of camp after much more research. But it would explain why they hid Loyalty.

By Trickster on Friday, December 14, 2001 - 06:03 pm:

I'd also like to note that earlier today, I managed to get a new skill, after a training session where I *didn't* manage to land any blows.

Sorry, I didn't think about jotting down the monster's stats at the time, but he was an A rank BlueTerror, trying to learn speed, and was at the point where Francesca had said that he'd "probably" learn a new skill.

I have to wonder if maybe the monsters have to meet different goals for different stat courses, in order to gain a skill...? And maybe this is why the different monsters are teachers? Like golem teaches speed, IIRC, so maybe you just have to avoid an attack/a few attacks? And maybe for the accuracy stat training you have to hit at least once..? Just an idea.

By the way, loyalty isn't on the monster data screens, but it's not really what I'd call "hidden" either... it shows up when you select the "battle" screen to choose a tournament.
